verses.text: 亞拿尼亞和撒非拉的鑒戒有一個人名叫亞拿尼亞，同他妻子撒非拉，把田產賣了。

words.note: A warning or lesson derived from past mistakes.

verses.text: 他私底下把錢留了一部分，妻子也知道這件事。他把其餘的一部分帶來，放在使徒的腳前。

words.note: Literally 'private bottom under'.
Literally 'sent disciple'.

verses.text: 彼得說：「亞拿尼亞，為甚麼撒但充滿了你的心，使你欺騙聖靈，私底下把賣地的錢留了一部分呢？

words.note: Literally 'holy spirit'.
Literally 'private bottom under'.

verses.text: 田地還沒有賣，不是你自己的嗎？既然賣了，所得的錢不是由你作主嗎？你為甚麼存心這樣作呢？你這不是欺騙人，而是欺騙 神。」

words.note: Literally 'act as master/owner'.
Literally 'to harbor a heart/intention'.
An ideographic space used before God/Lord to show reverence in some Bibles.

verses.text: 亞拿尼亞一聽見這話，就仆倒斷了氣。所有聽見的人都十分害怕。

words.note: Often paired with '就' (jiù) for 'as soon as...then'.
To fall prostrate, often implying sudden collapse or reverence.
Literally 'broke breath', meaning died.
Literally 'ten parts' or 'ten-tenths'.

verses.text: 有幾個青年人來把他包好，抬出去埋了。

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.

verses.text: 大約三小時之後，亞拿尼亞的妻子進來，還不知道發生了甚麼事。
彼得問她：「你告訴我，你們賣田地的錢，就是這麼多嗎？」她說：「是的，就是這麼多。」
彼得說：「你們為甚麼串同試探主的靈呢？你看，埋你丈夫的人的腳，已經到了門口，他們也要把你抬出去。」

words.note: Often used in a religious context for 'temptation' or 'testing God'.
Refers to God or Jesus in Christian contexts.
Often refers to the Holy Spirit in Christian contexts.
Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.

verses.text: 她立刻就仆倒在彼得腳前，斷了氣。那些青年人進來，發現她死了，把她也抬出去，埋在她丈夫旁邊。

words.note: An idiom meaning 'to die'.
Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.

verses.text: 全體會眾和所有聽見這事的人，都很害怕。

words.note: Lit. 'assembled multitude'
Verb-complement structure indicating successful perception.
Forms a descriptive phrase 'those who heard this matter'.

verses.text: 使徒行神蹟奇事主藉著使徒的手，在民間行了許多神蹟奇事。他們都同心聚集在所羅門廊下，

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple' or 'messenger disciple'.
Lit. 'divine trace' or 'God's sign'.
行 (perform) + 了 (completed aspect particle).
Used as a locative suffix here, similar to 'on'.

verses.text: 其餘的人，沒有一個敢接近他們，可是民眾都很敬重他們。
信主的男男女女越來越多，

words.note: A common verb-object compound in Christian contexts.
A reduplicative phrase emphasizing a group composed of both genders.
Structure meaning 'becoming increasingly...'

verses.text: 甚至有人把病人抬到街上，放在小床和褥子上，好讓彼得經過時，他的身影可以落在一些人身上。

words.note: Introduces object before verb for emphasis or specific actions.
Used as a locative suffix here.

words.definition: so that, in order to allow

words.note: Follows a clause to indicate 'when...'

verses.text: 耶路撒冷周圍城市的人，也帶著病人和受污靈纏擾的，蜂擁而來，結果病人全都醫好了。

words.note: Here '的' forms a noun phrase referring to 'those who are harassed by unclean spirits'.
Literary construction meaning 'and come'.

verses.text: 使徒受迫害大祭司和他的同黨撒都該人都起來，滿心忌恨，

words.note: Lit. 'sent followers' or 'messengers'.
Refers to the religious group known as Sadducees.

verses.text: 於是下手拿住使徒，把他們押在公共拘留所裡。
夜間有一位天使，打開監門，把他們領出來，說：

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 「你們去，站在殿裡，把一切有關這生命的話，都講給眾民聽。」
使徒聽完了，就在黎明的時候，進到殿裡去教導。大祭司和他的同黨來到了，就召集了公議會和以色列人的眾長老，派人到監牢去帶使徒出來。

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple'
Describes the transition from dark to light.
The chief religious official in ancient Israel.
The supreme judicial council in ancient Israel.

verses.text: 差役到了監裡，找不到他們，回來報告說：

words.note: Refers to a public servant or official.
Resultative complement: 'not succeed in finding'.

verses.text: 「我們發現監門緊閉，獄卒也守在門外；等到開了門，裡面連一個人也找不到。」

words.note: The character 卒 is also part of 'soldier' (兵卒).
Forms 'not even one' with '也'.

verses.text: 聖殿的守衛和祭司長聽了這些話，覺得很困惑，不知道這件事將來會怎樣。

words.note: A senior priest.

verses.text: 忽然有人來報告說：「你們押在監裡的那些人，正站在殿裡教導眾民呢！」

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts to refer to the general populace.
Indicates surprise or ongoing action/situation.

verses.text: 於是守衛和差役去帶使徒來，不過沒有用暴力，因為怕眾民用石頭打他們。

words.note: Refers to temple officers or servants.
Lit. 'sent disciple' or 'messenger disciple'.

verses.text: 既然帶來了，就叫他們站在公議會前。大祭司問他們：

words.note: Refers to the Jewish high council.

verses.text: 「我們嚴厲地吩咐過你們，不准再奉這名教導。看，你們卻把你們的道理傳遍了耶路撒冷，想要把流這人的血的責任推到我們身上。」

words.definition: to follow, in the name of
words.note: Often used in religious contexts, meaning 'to act by the authority of'.
Used as an interjection here.

words.definition: to want, to be going to
words.note: Often combined with 想 to express intention.

verses.text: 彼得和眾使徒回答：「服從 神過於服從人，是應當的。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional respectful character spacing in Chinese Bibles.
Turns the preceding phrase into a nominalized concept ('the thing that ought to be').

verses.text: 你們掛在木頭上親手殺害的耶穌，我們祖先的 神已經使他復活了。

words.note: In this context, referring to the cross or gallows.
The leading space is a traditional respectful character spacing in Chinese Bibles.
Lit. 'return to life'.

verses.text: 神把他高舉在自己的右邊，作元首作救主，把悔改的心賜給了以色列人，使他們罪得赦免。

words.note: Often refers to head of state.

verses.text: 我們為這些事作證， 神賜給順從的人的聖靈也為這些事作證。」
公議會的人聽了，非常惱怒，就想要殺他們。
但有一個法利賽人，名叫迦瑪列，是民眾所尊敬的律法教師。他在公議會中站起來，吩咐人把使徒暫時帶出去，

words.note: Refers to teachers of the Mosaic Law.

verses.text: 然後對大家說：「以色列人哪，你們應當小心處理這些人！
從前有個丟大，自命不凡，附從他的人約有四百。他一被殺，跟從他的人盡都星散，一敗塗地。

words.note: Lit. 'self-proclaimed not ordinary'.
Often used in religious contexts for discipleship.
Figurative idiom for wide dispersal.

words.definition: utterly defeated, suffered a crushing defeat
words.note: Lit. 'one defeat smeared on the ground'.

verses.text: 這人之後，在戶口登記的時候，又有一個加利利人猶大，拉攏人們來跟從他。後來他也喪命，跟從他的人也就煙消雲散了。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for discipleship.
A more formal way to say 'die'.
Often used in religious contexts for discipleship.

words.definition: vanished like smoke and clouds, disappeared
words.note: Figurative idiom for complete disappearance.

verses.text: 至於目前的事，我勸你們不要管這些人，由他們吧！因為這計劃或這行動，如果是出於人意，終必失敗；
如果是出於 神，你們就不能破壞他們，恐怕你們是與 神作對了。」他們接受了他的勸告，

words.note: The leading space is a reverence marker in some Bible editions.
The leading space is a reverence marker in some Bible editions.

verses.text: 就傳使徒進來，鞭打一頓，禁止他們奉耶穌的名傳講，就把他們釋放了。

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple/follower'.
頓 is a measure word for meals or actions like a beating.

words.definition: in the name of, respectfully receive
words.note: Used in formal or religious contexts for acting 'in the name of'.

verses.text: 使徒歡歡喜喜從公議會裡出來，因為他們算是配得為主的名受辱。

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple'
Reduplication for emphasis, forms an adverbial
The Jewish high council
Indicates worthiness to receive or obtain something
A title for Jesus or God

verses.text: 他們天天在殿裡並在各人的家中，不斷地教導，傳講耶穌是基督。

words.note: Reduplication of 'day' to mean 'every day'
Lit. 'not stopping'
Means 'Anointed One'
